description: Change of use from magistrates court (Use Class D1) for residential use (Use Class C3); conversion of existing building to create 7 self contained residential units; construction of a two storey building to create two maisonettes; and alterations to the rear of the superintendents house
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers Site Location Plan; Proposed Ground Floor Plan: 4323 Rev D; Proposed Lower Ground and First Floor Plan: 4323 Rev D; Proposed Second Floor and Roof Plan: 4323 Rev D; Proposed Elevations and Sections 4323 Rev D, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the brick and mortar mix to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the extension hereby approved is commenced.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan, policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the Environment and Supplementary Planning Document 4: Residential Extensions. | The following details, including large-scale elevations at a scale of 1:10 or larger, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved:  i.	New and replacement external doors and windows; ii.	Balustrades and screening to balconies and roof terraces; and iii.	Period cupola.  This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved.  Reason:  To ensure that the design of the development harmonises with the host building and conservation area, in accordance with 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan and policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the Environment. | Details of both hard and soft landscape works and boundary treatment, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants that die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan, policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the Environment and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 13 (Garden Space). | Details of refuse and recycling storage enclosures shall be submitted to and approved in writing.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of residents of the building and nearby occupiers in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse and Recycling'. | Secure parking for 15 cycle spaces for the site, in accordance with the adopted standards, shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved and shall be retained permanently thereafter.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan and policy 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004.	 | Details of sound attenuation measures from external noise and vibration together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential flats shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration). | The proposal shall be implemented in accordance with the programme of archaeological mitigation and Written Scheme of Investigation as approved in relation to condition 3 of planning application reference PP/2012/0738 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: Heritage assets of archaeological interest may survive on the site. The local planning authority wishes to secure the provision of archaeological investigation and the subsequent recording of the remains prior to development, in accordance with policy 4.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 7.8 of the London Plan 2011 and PPS5 'Planning for the Historic Environment.' | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards.  Reason: To increase the proportion of dwellings accessible to people with disabilities in line with the borough's needs, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and with policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The development hereby approved shall comply with the aims and objectives of 'Secured by Design'.  Reason: To ensure the safety of future residents, and to ensure that the development achieves the required crime prevention elements, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011) and the advice contained within the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 8: 'Safer Ealing'.
